intro: Steudelago ixoroides, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy, often yellow or white flowers. The plant features basal leaves with lobed or serrated edges and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
